title: THE DARK CRYSTAL: AGE OF RESISTANCE Ending Explained!
author: Think Story
comment: Can we take a minute to appreciate the fact that all the episode names were lines from the original.

The Skeksi in the movie isn't the General, he's SkekUng the Garthim Master. His name is mentioned when the Skeksis fret about whether they should summon all the rest of their people back to the castle when Hunter is dying. SkekUng also has vestigal wings and other physical traits that are different. And there are a few other Skeksis from the movie that haven't appeared in AoR yet, curious to see them show up in later seasons.
This series is better than it should be, the writing is fantastic, and the world is immersive

One of the saddest realizations in this season is that the Garthim are created by grafting the corpses of a Gruenak and an Arathim. As we see in the original Dark Crystal, there are many Garthim but no signs of Arathim or Gruenak. So we watching the beginning of not one, but three genocides, Gelfling, Arathim and Gruenak.
Everyone needs to spread word of how good this show is right now.
description:
In this video we break down the ending and explain Netflix's latest fantasy epic "The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance" the prequel to Jim Henson's 1982 film "The Dark Crystal". We'll also go into some season 2 theories as well!

The Dark Crystal (1982) Ending Explained:
